member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.DOM.Serialization.MathMLSerialization.MathDisplayValues
member.summary: Specifies whether the enclosed MathML expression should be rendered as a separate vertical block (in display style) or inline, aligned with adjacent text. When display="block", displaystyle is initialized to "true", whereas when display="inline", displaystyle is initialized to "false"; in both cases scriptlevel is initialized to 0 (See Section 3.1.6 Displaystyle and Scriptlevel). Moreover, when the math element is embedded in a larger document, a block math element should be treated as a block element as appropriate for the document type (typically as a new vertical block), whereas an inline math element should be treated as inline (typically exactly as if it were a sequence of words in normal text). In particular, this applies to spacing and linebreaking: for instance, there should not be spaces or line breaks inserted between inline math and any immediately following punctuation. When the display attribute is missing, a rendering agent is free to initialize as appropriate to the context. Default: Inline

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.DOM.Serialization.MathMLSerialization.MathMLOperators.c_operators
member.summary: See section "Operator Dictionary" in specification MathML Version 3.0: https://www.w3.org/TR/MathML3/appendixc.html#oper-dict.entries-table Some lines are commented out because they are duplicates.

member.summary: Specifies display style: inline or separate block. Default: MathDisplayValues.Inline

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Animation.Point.Formula
member.summary:
Formulas within values, from, to, by attributes can be made up of these: Standard arithmetic operators: +, -, *, /, ^, % (mod) Constants: pi e Conditional operators: abs, min, max, ? (if) Comparison operators: '==', '>=', '', '!=', '!' Trigonometric operators: sin(), cos(), tan(), asin(), acos(), atan() Natural logarithm ln() Property references (host supported properties)
for example: "#ppt_x+(cos(-2*pi*(1-$))*-#ppt_x-sin(-2*pi*(1-$))*(1-#ppt_y))*(1-$)" Read/write .

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.Drawing.GraphicPathFigureFactory
member.summary: A factory that produces APS paths representing different geometrical figures. ///

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.Drawing.GraphicPathFigureFactory.#ctor
member.summary: No ctor.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.Drawing.GraphicPathFigureFactory.AddToPath(Aspose.Foundation.Rendering.Aps.ApsPath@,Aspose.Slides.Drawing.Xamarin.PointF[],Aspose.Slides.Drawing.Xamarin.Drawing2D.PathPointType[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds points to the ApsPath based on GDI+
member.remarks: Each point in a GraphicsPath object has a type associated with it. The type determines how the point is used to draw the path. Point types that make up shapes include start points, stop points, and Bezier curve points. Types also include markers, which allow easy traversal of a path or a mask to show or hide points. The Line type and any of the Bezier types can be combined with CloseSubpath (by using the bitwise operator OR) to indicate that the corresponding point is the last point in a figure and that the figure should be closed.

member.param: ArrayList of the figure segment points

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.Charts.DataLabelFormat
member.summary: Represents formatting options for DataLabel.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.DataLabelFormat.IsNumberFormatLinkedToSource
member.summary: Read/write .
member.remarks: If parent of this DataLabelFormat object is a DataLabelCollection collection of data labels then this property gets or sets the default value of the IsNumberFormatLinkedToSource property for the new data labels in the DataLabelCollection collection. Set this property with value also sets this value to the IsNumberFormatLinkedToSource property for all data labels in the DataLabelCollection collection (i.e. "DataLabels.DefaultDataLabelFormat.IsNumberFormatLinkedToSource = val;" cause to all DataLabels[i].IsNumberFormatLinkedToSource is equal to val).

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.DataLabelFormat.NumberFormat
member.summary: Represents the format string for the DataLabels object. Read/write .
member.remarks: If parent of this DataLabelFormat object is a DataLabelCollection collection of data labels then this property gets or sets the default value of the NumberFormat property for the new data labels in the DataLabelCollection collection. Represents the format string for the DataLabel objects. Set this property with value also sets this value to the NumberFormat property for all data labels in the DataLabelCollection collection (i.e. "DataLabels.DefaultDataLabelFormat.NumberFormat = val;" cause to all DataLabels[i].NumberFormat is equal to val).

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.DataLabelFormat.Format
member.summary: Represents the format of the data label. Read-only .
member.remarks: If parent of this DataLabelFormat object is a DataLabelCollection collection of data labels then this property represents the default format for the new data labels in the DataLabelCollection collection.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.DataLabelFormat.Position
member.summary: Represents the position of the data label. Read/write .
member.remarks: If parent of this DataLabelFormat object is a DataLabelCollection collection of data labels then this property gets or sets the default value of the Position property for the new data labels in the DataLabelCollection collection. Represents the position for the DataLabel objects. member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.Charts.ChartPortionFormat
member.summary: This class contains the chart portion formatting properties used in charts. Unlike , all properties of this class are writeable.

remarks.para: This class is used to return and manipulate text portion formatting properties defined for the particular portion. This means that no inheritance is applied when getting values so for the majority of cases you will get values meaning "undefined".
In order to get the effective formatting parameter values including inherited you need to use method which returns a instance.

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.Charts.ChartData
member.summary: Represents data used for a chart plotting.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.ChartData.ChartDataWorkbook
member.summary: Gets the cells factory to create cells used for chart series or categories. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.ChartData.Series
member.summary: Gets the series. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.ChartData.SeriesGroups
member.summary: Gets the groups of series. Read-only .
member.remarks:
1) Each group of series contains series with combinable types. Groups of combinable series types defined and described with CombinableSeriesTypesGroup enum. Also each group of series contains series witch is plotted whether on primary axes or on secondary axes (not both cases in one group). So, principle of series grouping is a grouping by type groups mentioned above and by primary/secondary plotting type.
2) Group of series contains some series properies whitch is common for each series in group ("series group properties"). "Series group properties" in ChartSeriesGroup class is read/write. Each of "series group properties" can have a read-only projection in ChartSeries class.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.ChartData.Categories
member.summary: Gets the primary categories (or both primary and secondary categories if property is false). Read-only .
member.remarks: If property is false then property return null and data in this property is used both for primary and secondary series. If property is true then data in property is used for secondary series and data in this property is used for primary series.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.ChartData.UseSecondaryCategories
member.summary: If false then property return null and data in property is used both for primary and secondary series. If true then data in property is used for secondary series and data in property is used for primary series. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.ChartData.SecondaryCategories
member.summary: Gets the secondary categories if property is true. Read-only .
member.remarks: If property is false then this property return null and data in property is used both for primary and secondary series. If property is true then data in this property is used for secondary series and data in property is used for primary series.

member.exception: Chart doesn't use workbook as a data source

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.Charts.ChartData.SetRange(System.String)
member.summary: Set chart data range. Series and categories will be updated based on new data range. If amount of series in data range greater than count of series in the chart data then additional series with the same type as a last series in the current collection will be added to the end of the collection.
member.param: The cells data range formula. E.g: "Sheet1!$A$1:$C$4" , "SomeSheetName!A1:B100", "Sheet1!$A$1:$B$5;Sheet1!$D$1:$D$5".
member.exception: formula is null.
Unsupported chart type
formula has incorrect format.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.Charts.ChartData.SetExternalWorkbook(System.String)
member.summary: Sets external workbook as a data source for the chart. Chart data will be updated from the target workbook.
member.exception: External workbook is not available or can't be loaded.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.Charts.ChartData.SetExternalWorkbook(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets external workbook as a data source for the chart.
member.param: If value is false only workbook path will be updated. Chart data won't be loaded and updated from the target workbook. Can be used when target workbook doesn't exist or it's not available. If value is true chart data will be updated from the target workbook.
member.exception: External workbook is not available or can't be loaded.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.Charts.ChartDataPointCollection.GetOrCreateDataPointByIdx(System.UInt32)
member.summary: If collection already contains data point with index then returns this data point. If collection doesn't contains data point with index ==N (when number of data points in this collection is less or equal then N) then adds deficient data points and returns last (which has requested index). For example, collection indexes are {0, 1, 2}, and requested index is 5. Then method adds deficient data points: {0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5}. And returns data point with index 5.
member.returns: Returns data point with requested index.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.ChartSeries.TrendLines
member.summary: Collection of series trend lines. Read-only .
member.remarks: TrendLines are available (not null) for data series in unstacked 2-D area, bar, column, line, stock, xy (scatter), and bubble charts. A trendline are not available for data series in any chart type that is stacked or 3-D. Trendlines are also not available for radar, pie, surface, or doughnut charts.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.ChartSeries.ErrorBarsXFormat
member.summary:
Represents ErrorBars of series with derection X.
ErrorBars with X direction are avalible for series of type area, bar, scatter and bubble. For any other types of chart this property returns null (including 3D charts). In case of custom values use DataPoints collection to specify value (with property).
Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.ChartSeries.ErrorBarsYFormat
member.summary:
Represents ErrorBars of series with derection Y.
ErrorBars with Y direction are avalible for series of type area, bar, line, scatter and bubble. For any other types of chart this property returns null (including 3D charts). In case of custom values use DataPoints collection to specify value (with property).
Read-only .

member.summary: Represents outlier points. True if outlier points are shown on the BoxAndWhisker chart. Applies only to BoxAndWhisker charts. Read/write .

member.summary: Gets collection of aggregated data points. Aggregated data points are result of processing chart categories and chart data points based on series type. Available for BoxAndWhisker, Histogram, HistogramPareto series types.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.ChartSeries.AggregatedDataPointsInternal
member.summary: Returns collection of aggregated data points.Aggregated data points are result of processing chart categories and chart data points based on series type. Available for BoxAndWhisker, Histogram, HistogramPareto, Treemap and Sunburst series types. FOR INTERNAL USE ONLY

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.ChartSeries.HasUpDownBars
member.summary: Determines whether Line- or Stock-chart has a up/down bars. This is the property not only of this series but of all series of parent series group - this is projection of appropriate group property. And so this property is read-only. Use ParentSeriesGroup property for access to parent series group. Use ParentSeriesGroup.UpDownBars.HasUpDownBars read/write property for change value. Use ParentSeriesGroup.UpDownBars property for format up/down bars. Read-only .

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.Charts.ChartSeriesGroupCollection
member.summary: Represents the collection of groups of combinable series.
member.remarks:
1) Each group of series contains series with combinable types. Groups of combinable series types defined and described with CombinableSeriesTypesGroup enum. Also each group of series contains series witch is plotted whether on primary axes or on secondary axes (not both cases in one group). So, principle of series grouping is a grouping by type groups mentioned above and by primary/secondary plotting type.
2) Group of series contains some series properties which is common for each series in group ("series group properties"). "Series group properties" in ChartSeriesGroup class is read/write. Each of "series group properties" can have a read-only projection in ChartSeries class.

member.summary: Returns a synchronization root. Read-only .

member.summary: Returns an enumerator that iterates through the collection.
member.returns: A that can be used to iterate through the collection.

member.summary: False means that data label is not visible (and so all Show*-flags (ShowValue, ...) are false). Read-only .
member.remarks: If data label is visible you can make it hidden with Hide() method. But if data label is not visible (IsVisible is false) you can make data label visible with setting Show*-flags (ShowValue, ...) to true state.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.Charts.DataLabel.Hide
member.summary: Make data label hidden by setting all Show*-flags (ShowValue, ...) to false state. IsVisible will be false after this.
member.remarks: If data label is not visible (IsVisible is false) you can make data label visible with setting Show*-flags (ShowValue, ...) to true state.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.DataLabel.TextFrameForOverriding
member.summary: Can contain a rich formatted text. If this property is not null then this formatted text value overrides auto-generated text of data label. Auto-generated text of data label means text that is managed by ShowSeriesName, ShowValue, ... properties and is formatted with the TextFormatManager.TextFormat property. Read-only .

Set this property with value also sets this value to the IsNumberFormatLinkedToSource property for all data labels in the DataLabelCollection collection (i.e. "DataLabels.DefaultDataLabelFormat.IsNumberFormatLinkedToSource = val;" cause to all DataLabels[i].IsNumberFormatLinkedToSource is equal to val). Read/write .

Set this property with value also sets this value to the NumberFormat property for all data labels in the DataLabelCollection collection (i.e. "DataLabels.DefaultDataLabelFormat.NumberFormat = val;" cause to all DataLabels[i].NumberFormat is equal to val).

member.summary: Represents 3D rotation of a chart.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.Rotation3D.RotationX
member.summary: Returns or sets the rotation degree around the X-axis, i.e. in the Y direction for 3D charts (between -90 and 90 degrees). The property matches with the 21.2.2.157 rotX (X Rotation) item in ECMA-376 and with the "Y Rotation" option in PowerPoint 2007+. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.Rotation3D.RotationY
member.summary: Returns or sets the rotation degree around the Y-axis, i.e. in the X direction for 3D charts (between 0 and 360 degrees). The property matches with the 21.2.2.158 rotY (Y Rotation) item in ECMA-376 and with the "X Rotation" option in PowerPoint 2007+. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.Rotation3D.Perspective
member.summary: Returns or sets the perspective value (field of view angle) for 3D charts (between 0 and 240). Ignored if RightAngleAxes property value is true. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.Rotation3D.RightAngleAxes
member.summary: Determines whether the chart axes are at right angles, rather than drawn in perspective. In other words it determines whether the chart angles of axes are independent from chart rotation or elevation. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.Rotation3D.DepthPercents
member.summary: Returns or sets the depth of a 3D chart as a percentage of a chart width (between 20 and 2000 percent). Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.Rotation3D.HeightPercents
member.summary: Specifies the height of a 3-D chart as a percentage of the chart width (between 5 and 500 percent). Read/write .

member.summary: Specifies the number of categories (or units on a scatter chart) that the trendline extends after the data for the series that is being trended. On scatter and non-scatter charts, the value shall be any non-negative value. Read/write .

member.summary: Specifies the value where the trendline shall cross the y axis. This property shall be supported only when the trendline type is exp, linear, or poly. Read/write .

member.summary: Specifies that the equation for the trendline is displayed on the chart (in the same label as the Rsquaredvalue). Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.Trendline.Order
member.summary: Specifies the order of the polynomial trend line. It is ignored for other trend line types. Value must be between 2 and 6. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.Trendline.Period
member.summary: Specifies the period of the trend line for a moving average trend line. It is ignored for other trend line variants. Value must be between 2 and 255. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Charts.Trendline.DisplayRSquaredValue
member.summary: Specifies that the R-squared value of the trendline is displayed on the chart (in the same label as the equation). Read/write .

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.Charts.LeaderLineElement.TrySetTarget(Aspose.Slides.Drawing.Xamarin.RectangleF,Aspose.Slides.Drawing.Xamarin.PointF[],Aspose.Slides.Drawing.Xamarin.PointF[],System.Boolean,Aspose.Slides.Drawing.Xamarin.PointF@,Aspose.Slides.Drawing.Xamarin.PointF@)
member.summary: Tries set target points.
member.param: Possible start points of the leader (lays on bar, line, sector etc).
Possible end points of the leader (lays on label).

Is allowed a strict vertical leader line. If strict line is allowed, vertical line will be drawn from start point to perpendicular label top or bottom side. If strict line is not allowed, vertical line will be drawn from start point to central point on label top or bottom side.
member.returns: True if targets have set successfully, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.Charts.BaseChartValue.#ctor(Aspose.Slides.IDOMObject,Aspose.Slides.Charts.DataSourceTypeHolder,System.Boolean)
member.param: 1) If true then DataSourceType depends on dataSourceTypeHolder whitch is passed as parameter into constructor. And there is no other way to change DataSourceType but to change DataSourceTypeHolder.DataSourceType value. And if one dataSourceTypeHolder is passed to multiple BaseChartValue instances then it is the way to centralized managing of type of multiple BaseChartValue-values. 2) If false then it is possible to change DataSourceType.

member.summary: A brush whose attributes are inherited by this brush.

member.summary: Annotations

member.summary: AnnotationXMLs

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Ink.InkBrush.Width
member.summary: Width of the brush. If the width property is not given and a BW channel is present, the values of the BW channel are used as the brush width. The default value is defined by the application.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Ink.InkBrush.Height
member.summary: Height of the brush. If a height property is not given and a BH channel is present, the values of the BH channel are used as the brush height. The default value is defined by the application.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Ink.InkBrush.Color
member.summary: Color of brush as three octets for RGB. If a color property is not given and color channels are present(C or CR, CG, CB or CC, CM, CY, CK), their values are used for the color. Default is #000000.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Ink.InkBrush.Size
member.summary: Gets the size of Brush depending of its units Read-only.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Ink.InkBrush.Transparency
member.summary: Transparency of brush as an integer: 0 is opaque. If a transparency property is not given and the transparency channel(A) is present, its value is used. Default is 0.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Ink.InkBrush.Tip
member.summary: The type of pen tip: ellipse, rectangle, or drop. If ellipse, then the width property specifies the horizontal diameter, and the height property specifies the vertical diameter.If the height property is absent, its default value is the value of width. If rectangle, the width and height properties specify the width and height of the rectangle.If the height property is absent, the default value is the value of width making the brush a square. If drop, the shape is defined by a circle and two tangent lines to a point outside the circle, located above the circle on the vertical axis, as shown in Figure 4. The width property is the diameter the circle part, and the height property is the maximum diameter of the shape. Default is ellipse. If the OR channel is present, the tip shape is rotated counter-clockwise by this amount about its origin.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Ink.InkBrush.RasterOp
member.summary: A value that defines how the colors of the pen and background interact. In the example images below, the original background is white with the black text 'abc' and it is overwritten with a single curved yellow ink stroke. noOperation specifies no operation; the background is rendered without ink. copyPen specifies that the current pen color property is used and overwrites the background. maskPen specifies a combination of the colors common to both the pen and the display.This value simulates the effect of a highlighter pen. The default value is copyPen, which indicates that the current pen color is used. Applications may define additional rasterOp values.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Ink.InkBrush.AntiAliased
member.summary: The drawn ink is anti-aliased. Default is true.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Ink.InkBrush.FitToCurve
member.summary: If this value is set to true, the ink is rendered as a series of curves versus as lines between pen sample points. Default is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Ink.InkBrush.IgnorePressure
member.summary: If true, pressure from the pen tip is ignored and the width of the ink remains the same regardless of the pressure of the pen on the tablet surface. If false, the width of the ink gets wider with increased pressure of the pen on the tablet surface. Default is false.

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.Ink.InkCanvas
member.summary: Represents the virtual coordinate system, which uniquely identifies a shared virtual space for cooperation of ink applications. Together with the trace-to-canvas coordinate transform, it provides a common frame of reference for ink collected in multiple sessions on different devices.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Ink.InkCanvas.Id
member.summary: The unique identifier for this object.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Ink.InkCanvas.TraceFormatRef
member.summary: A link to a InkTraceFormat object.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Ink.InkCanvas.InkTraceFormat
member.summary: Describes the format used to encode points within InkTrace objects

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.Ink.InkCanvasTransform
member.summary: Represents an InkAnnotationXML object on a slide. This class is used to relate two coordinate systems. The source and target coordinate systems are ultimately defined in terms of InkTraceFormat object. These trace formats may either be given directly, or indirectly by InkSource, InkContext or other InkCanvas objects.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Ink.InkCanvasTransform.Id
member.summary: The identifier for this canvas transform.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Ink.InkCanvasTransform.Invertible
member.summary: Default: false

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Ink.InkCanvasTransform.Mapping
member.summary: Gets or sets InkMapping object

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Ink.InkCanvasTransform.SecondMapping
member.summary: Gets or sets inverse mapping from the target back to the source

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.Ink.InkChannel
member.summary: Represents an InkChannel object.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Ink.InkChannel.Id
member.summary: The unique identifier for this element.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Ink.InkChannel.Name
member.summary: The case sensitive name of this channel.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Ink.InkChannel.Type
member.summary: The data type of the point values for this channel. Default: "decimal"

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Ink.InkChannel.Default
member.summary: The default value of the point data for this channel.This only applies to intermittent channels. Default: 0 (for integer or decimal channel), F (for boolean channel)

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Ink.InkChannel.Min
member.summary: The lower boundary for the values of this channel.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Ink.InkChannel.Max
member.summary: The upper boundary for the values of this channel.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Ink.InkChannel.Orientation
member.summary: The orientation of increasing channel values with respect to the default direction of the channel's coordinate axis, where applicable. Default: "Positive"

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Ink.InkChannel.RespectTo
member.summary: Specifies that the values are relative to another reference point.The reference point may be the URI of a InkTimestamp for time channels, or an application defined URI for application specific channels.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Ink.InkChannel.Units
member.summary: The units in which the values of the channel are expressed (numerical channels only).

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Ink.InkChannel.Threshold
member.summary: Threshold - e.g. for a binary channel, the threshold force at which the tip switch is activated

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Ink.InkChannel.Resolution
member.summary: Resolution - the scale of the values recorded.This may be expressed as fractions of a unit, e.g. 1/1000 in (inches), 0.1 mm, 1 deg (degrees). It may also be expressed, more popularly, in inverse units, e.g. "1000 points per inch" would be given as 1000 in units 1/in.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Ink.InkChannel.Quantization
member.summary: Quantization - the unit of smallest change in the reported values.If the value is reported as integer, this is assumed to be the same as the resolution. Note that if decimal values are recorded for resolution, the quantization of the data may be smaller than the "resolution".

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Ink.InkChannel.Noise
member.summary: Noise - the RMS value of noise typically observed on the channel. This is distinct from accuracy! It is an indication of the difference observed in the data from the device when the same path is traced out multiple times (e.g.by a robot).

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Ink.InkChannel.Accuracy
member.summary: Accuracy - the typical accuracy of the data on the channel(e.g. "0.5 mm", "10 degrees" or "0.1 Newton") This is the typical difference between the reported position and the actual position of the pen tip(or tilt ...)

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Ink.InkChannel.CrossCoupling
member.summary: Cross-coupling - the distortion in the data from one channel due to changes in another channel.For example, the X and Y coordinates in an electromagnetic digitizer are influenced by the tilt of the pen.This would be specified by dX/dOTx = ...or max delta X vs. OTx = ... If the influencing channels are also recorded, and the cross-couplings are accurately specified, it may be possible to compensate for the cross-coupling by subtracting the influence, at the expense of higher noise. The cross-coupling is always expressed in the units of the two channels, e.g. if X mm and OTx is in degrees, then cross-coupling is in mm/deg.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Ink.InkChannel.Skew
member.summary: Skew - the temporal skew of this channel relative to the basic device latency, if any.For example, some devices actually sample X and Y at different points in time, so one might have a skew of -5 millisecond, and the other +5 millisecond.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Ink.InkChannel.MinBandwidth
member.summary: Minimum bandwidth (in Hz) - the minimum bandwidth of the channel, in Hz(not samples/second), i.e., the frequency of input motion up to which the signal is accurate to within 3dB.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Ink.InkChannel.PeakRate
member.summary: Peak rate - the maximum speed at which the device can accurately track motion

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Ink.InkChannel.Distortion
member.summary: Dynamic distortion, e.g., how velocity affects position accuracy.This is expressed in inverse seconds, e.g. 0.01 mm / mm / s. This kind of distortion is often cross channel, but this specification only allows a generic, channel-specific value.

member.summary: Represents the data type of the point values for a trace

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.MathText.Rendering.MathFontMetrics.FractionNumeratorShiftUp
member.summary: Standard shift up applied to the numerator.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.MathText.Rendering.MathFontMetrics.FractionDenominatorShiftDown
member.summary: Standard shift down applied to the denominator. Positive for moving in the downward direction.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.MathText.Rendering.MathFontMetrics.FractionNumeratorGapMin
member.summary: Minimum tolerated gap between the (ink) bottom of the numerator and the ink of the fraction bar.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.MathText.Rendering.MathFontMetrics.FractionDenominatorGapMin
member.summary: Minimum tolerated gap between the (ink) top of the denominator and the ink of the fraction bar.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.MathText.Rendering.MathFontMetrics.Axis
member.summary: Axis height of the font. In math typesetting, the term axis refers to a horizontal reference line used for positioning elements in a formula. The math axis is similar to but distinct from the baseline for regular text layout. For example, in a simple equation, a minus symbol or fraction rule would be on the axis, but a string for a variable name would be set on a baseline that is offset from the axis. The axisHeight value determines the amount of that offset.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.MathText.Rendering.MathFontMetrics.FractionRuleThickness
member.summary: Thickness of the fraction bar.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.MathText.Rendering.MathFontMetrics.SkewedFractionHorizontalGap
member.summary: Horizontal distance between the top and bottom elements of a skewed fraction.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.MathText.Rendering.MathFontMetrics.SkewedFractionVerticalGap
member.summary: Vertical distance between the ink of the top and bottom elements of a skewed fraction.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.MathText.Rendering.MathFontMetrics.SuperscriptShiftUp
member.summary: Standard shift up applied to superscript elements

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.MathText.Rendering.MathFontMetrics.SuperscriptShiftUpCramped
member.summary: Standard shift of superscripts relative to the base, in cramped style.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.MathText.Rendering.MathFontMetrics.SuperscriptBottomMin
member.summary: Minimum allowed height of the (ink) bottom of superscripts that does not require moving subscripts further up. Suggested: x-height.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.MathText.Rendering.MathFontMetrics.SuperscriptBaselineDropMax
member.summary: Maximum allowed drop of the baseline of superscripts relative to the (ink) top of the base. Checked for bases that are treated as a box or extended shape. Positive for superscript baseline below the base top.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.MathText.Rendering.MathFontMetrics.SuperscriptBottomMaxWithSubscript
member.summary: The maximum level to which the (ink) bottom of superscript can be pushed to increase the gap between superscript and subscript, before subscript starts being moved down. Suggested: 4/5 x-height.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.MathText.Rendering.MathFontMetrics.SpaceAfterScript
member.summary: Extra white space to be added after each subscript and superscript. Suggested: 0.5 pt for a 12 pt font.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.MathText.Rendering.MathFontMetrics.ScriptPercentScaleDown
member.summary: Percentage of scaling down for level 1 superscripts and subscripts.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.MathText.Rendering.MathFontMetrics.ScriptScriptPercentScaleDown
member.summary: Percentage of scaling down for level 2 (scriptScript) superscripts and subscripts.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.MathText.Rendering.MathFontMetrics.SubscriptShiftDown
member.summary: The standard shift down applied to subscript elements. Positive for moving in the downward direction

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.MathText.Rendering.MathFontMetrics.SubscriptTopMax
member.summary: Maximum allowed height of the (ink) top of subscripts that does not require moving subscripts further down.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.MathText.Rendering.MathFontMetrics.SubscriptBaselineDropMin
member.summary: Minimum allowed drop of the baseline of subscripts relative to the (ink) bottom of the base. Checked for bases that are treated as a box or extended shape. Positive for subscript baseline dropped below the base bottom.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.MathText.Rendering.MathFontMetrics.SubSuperscriptGapMin
member.summary: Minimum gap between the superscript and subscript ink.

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.MathText.Rendering.MathFontMetrics.c_spacingOfMathOperator
member.summary: Spacing for mathematical operators as a fraction of font height

member.name: F:Aspose.Slides.MathText.Rendering.MathFontMetrics.c_radicalKernBeforeDegree
member.summary: Extra horizontal kern before the degree of a radical, if such is present. Suggested: 5/18 of em.

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.MathText.MathBox
member.summary: Specifies the logical boxing (packaging) of mathematical element. For example, a boxed object can serve as an operator emulator with or without an alignment point, serve as a line break point, or be grouped such as not to allow line breaks within. For example, the "==" operator should be boxed to prevent line breaks.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.MathText.MathBox.Base
member.summary: Base argument

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.MathText.MathBox.OperatorEmulator
member.summary: Operator Emulator. When true, the box and its contents behave as a single operator and inherit the properties of an operator. This means, for example, that the character can serve as a point for a line break and can be aligned to other operators. Operator Emulators are often used when one or more glyphs combine to form an operator, such as '=='. Default value: false

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.MathText.MathBox.NoBreak
member.summary: No break This property specifies the "unbreakable" property on the object box. When true, no line breaks can occur within the box. This can be important for operator emulators that consist of more than one binary operator. When this element is not specified, breaks can occur inside box. Default: true

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.MathText.MathBox.Differential
member.summary: Differential When true, the box acts as a differential (e.g., in an integrand), and receives the appropriate horizontal spacing for the mathematical differential. Default: false

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.MathText.MathBox.AlignmentPoint
member.summary: When true, this operator emulator serves as an alignment point; that is, designated alignment points in other equations can be aligned with it. Default: false

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.MathText.MathBox.ExplicitBreak
member.summary: Explicit break specifies whether there is a line break at the start of the Box object, such that the line wraps at the start of the box object. Specifies the number of the operator on the previous line of mathematical text which shall be used as the alignment point for the current line of mathematical text possible values: 1..255 Default: 0 (no explicit break)

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.MathText.MathBox.#ctor(Aspose.Slides.MathText.IMathElement)
member.summary: Initializes MathBox with the specified element as an argument
member.param: The base element to which the box is applied. Can be null.

member.summary: Specifies a grouping symbol above or below an expression, usually to highlight the relationship between elements

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.MathText.MathGroupingCharacter.Base
member.summary: Base argument

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.MathText.MathGroupingCharacter.Character
member.summary: Grouping Character Default value: U+23DF (BOTTOM CURLY BRACKET)
member.example:
Example:
[C#] MathGroupingCharacter groupingCharacter = new MathGroupingCharacter(new MathematicalText("abc")); groupingCharacter.Character = '\u23DD'; // Bottom Parenthesis

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.MathText.MathGroupingCharacter.Position
member.summary: Position of grouping character. Default: Bottom

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.MathText.MathGroupingCharacter.VerticalJustification
member.summary: Vertical justification of group character. Specifies the alignment of the object with respect to the baseline. For example, when the group character is above the object, VerticalJustification of Top signifies that the top of the object falls on the baseline; when VerticalJustification is set to Bottom, the bottom of the object is on the baseline Default: Bottom for Position=Top, and Top for Position=Bottom

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.MathText.MathMatrix
member.summary: Specifies the Matrix object, consisting of child elements laid out in one or more rows and columns. It is important to note that matrices do not have built in delimiters. To place the matrix in the brackets you should use the delimiter object (IMathDelimiter). Null arguments can be used to create gaps in matrices.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.MathText.MathMatrix.RowCount
member.summary: Number of rows in the matrix

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.MathText.MathMatrix.ColumnCount
member.summary: Number of columns in the matrix

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.MathText.MathMatrix.HidePlaceholders
member.summary: Hide the placeholders for empty matrix elements Default: false

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.MathText.MathMatrix.BaseJustification
member.summary: Specifies the vertical justification respect to surrounding text. Possible values are top, bottom, and center. Default: Center

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.MathText.MathMatrix.MinColumnWidth
member.summary: Minimum column width in twips (1/20th of a point) The gap spacing (also referred to as Column Gap or Gap Width) is added to the MinColumnWidth to determine the total Matrix Column Spacing (distance between the same edges of different columns). Default: 0.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.MathText.MathMatrix.ColumnGapRule
P:Aspose.Slides.MathText.MathMatrix.ColumnGap
member.summary: The value of horizontal spacing between columns of a matrix; If the ColumnGapRule is set to 3 ("Exactly"), then the unit is interpreted as twips (1/20th of a point) If the ColumnGapRule is set to 4 ("Multiple"), then the unit is interpreted as number of 0.5 em increments. In other cases ignored. Default: 0

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.MathText.MathMatrix.RowGapRule
P:Aspose.Slides.MathText.MathMatrix.RowGap
member.summary: The value of vertical spacing between rows of a matrix; If the RowGapRule is set to 3 ("Exactly"), then the unit is interpreted as twips (1/20th of a point) If the RowGapRule is set to 4 ("Multiple"), then the unit is interpreted as half-lines. Default: 0

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.MathText.MathMatrix.Item(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Element of matrix
member.param: The zero-based index of the row to get item
The zero-based index of the column to get item

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.MathText.MathDelimiter
member.summary: Specifies the delimiter object, consisting of opening and closing characters (such as parentheses, braces, brackets, and vertical bars), and one or more mathematical elements inside, separated by a specified character. Examples: (2); [2|2]

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.MathText.MathDelimiter.Arguments
member.summary: One or more mathematical elements separated by delimiter characters

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.MathText.MathDelimiter.BeginningCharacter
member.summary: Delimiter Beginning Character specifies the beginning, or opening, delimiter character. Mathematical delimiters are enclosing characters such as parentheses, brackets, and braces. The default: '('.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.MathText.MathDelimiter.SeparatorCharacter
member.summary: Delimiter Separator Character specifies the character that separates arguments in the delimiter object. The default: '|'.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.MathText.MathDelimiter.EndingCharacter
member.summary: Delimiter Ending Character specifies the ending, or closing, delimiter character. Mathematical delimiters are enclosing characters such as parentheses, brackets, and braces. The default: ')'.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.MathText.MathDelimiter.GrowToMatchOperandHeight
member.summary: Specifies the growth of BeginningCharacter, SeparatorCharacter, EndingCharacter When true, the delimiters grows vertically to match its operand height. The default value is true

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.MathText.MathDelimiter.DelimiterShape
member.summary: Specifies the shape of delimiters in the delimiter object. When is MathDelimiterShape.Centered, delimiters are centered around the math axis of the mathematical text and still be made to fit the entire height of their contents. When is MathDelimiterShape.Match, their height and shape are altered to exactly match their contents.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.MathText.MathDelimiter.#ctor(Aspose.Slides.MathText.IMathElement)
member.summary: Initializes MathDelimiter with the specified element as single base argument
member.param: The base element to which the delimiter is applied. Can be null.
member.exception: Throws then is a container for another elements, such as MathBlock. In this case, you need to call a different constructor with IEnumerable argument.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.MathText.MathDelimiter.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Aspose.Slides.MathText.IMathElement},System.Object)
member.summary: Initializes MathDelimiter with the specified elements as base arguments
member.param: The base elements to which the delimiter is applied. Can't be null.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.MathText.MathDelimiter.Delimit(System.Char)
member.summary: Delimits arguments using the specified delimiter character
member.returns: This object after applying the delimiter character

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.MathText.MathDelimiter.Enclose(System.Char,System.Char)
member.summary: Encloses a math element in specified characters such as parenthesis or another characters as framing
member.returns: If and are null, corresponding properties are assigned values only and no new object is created (returns this instance). Otherwise, returns new math element of type Delimiter which includes specified characters as framing and this instance of framed inside.

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.MathText.MathArgument
member.summary: The typical argument of mathematical operations (of mathematical elements)

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.MathText.MathArgument.ArgumentSize
member.summary:
Relative argument size for rendering This property does not specify an absolute size, rather relative to its starting size. The default value is different, depending on the type of element.
Most arguments begin at the normal size which will be defined as 0, but some begin, by default smaller or larger than the normal size. For instance, 1 represents that it is one size larger than normal, 2 represents that it is two sizes larger than normal, -1 represents that it is one size smaller than normal, and -2 represents that it is two sizes smaller than normal.
Not all arguments can be edited, check this by calling IsArgumentSizeEditable. The size can be changed on those arguments: box base (IMathBox.Base), group-character base (IMathGroupingCharacter.Base), lower and upper limits limit (IMathLimit.Base), n-ary operator limits (IMathNaryOperator.LowerLimit and IMathNaryOperator.UpperLimit), radical degree (IMathRadical.Degree), all types of subscript and superscripts (such as IMathSuperscriptElement.Superscript).

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.MathText.MathArgument.IsArgumentSizeEditable
member.summary: Return true if ArgumentSize can be changed by ArgumentSize setter. If false, attempting the change will result in an exception

member.summary: Places this element in a group using a bottom curly bracket

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.MathText.MathElementBase.Group(System.Char,Aspose.Slides.MathText.MathTopBotPositions,Aspose.Slides.MathText.MathTopBotPositions)
member.summary: Places this element in a group using a grouping character such as bottom curly bracket or another
member.param: Grouping Character such as BOTTOM CURLY BRACKET (U+23DF) or any other

Vertical justification of group character. Specifies the alignment of the object with respect to the baseline. For example, when the group character is above the object, VerticalJustification of Top signifies that the top of the object falls on the baseline; when VerticalJustification is set to Bottom, the bottom of the object is on the baseline

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.MathText.MathElementBase.ToBox
member.summary: Places this element in a non-visual box (logical grouping) which is used to group components of an equation or other instance of mathematical text. A boxed object can (for example) serve as an operator emulator with or without an alignment point, serve as a line break point, or be grouped such as not to allow line breaks within.
member.returns: Logical box with this element placed inside

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.LinearAlgorithm
member.summary: Represents Linear layout algorithm

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.CompositeAlgorithmParameter
member.summary: Represents parameter for composite algorithm

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.CompositeAlgorithmParameter.AspectRatio
member.summary: Specifies the aspect ratio (width to height) of the composite node to use when determining child constraints. A value of 0 specifies to leave the width and height constraints unaltered. The algorithm may temporarily shrink one dimension to achieve the specified ratio. For example, if a composite node has a width constraint of 20 and height constraint of 10, and if the value of ar is 1.5, the composite algorithm uses a width value of 15 to calculate the composite nodes child constraints. However, the algorithm does not propagate this value to other nodes. Read-only .

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.ConnectorAlgorithmParameter
member.summary: Represents parameter for connector algorithm

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.ConnectorAlgorithmParameter.SourceNode
member.summary: Specifies the name of the layout node from which to start the connection. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.ConnectorAlgorithmParameter.DestionationNode
member.summary: Specifies the name of the layout node from which to end the connection. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.ConnectorAlgorithmParameter.Dimension
member.summary: Indicates that the connector should use a 1-D line or a 2-D object that has width. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.ConnectorAlgorithmParameter.BeginningPoints
member.summary: Specifies all points on the shape at which the connector may begin. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.ConnectorAlgorithmParameter.EndPoints
member.summary: Specifies all points on the shape at which the connector may end. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.ConnectorAlgorithmParameter.Routing
member.summary: Specifies whether the connector is drawn as a single straight line, orthogonal lines with a single bend, or a curve that uses the diam constraint. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.ConnectorAlgorithmParameter.ShaftThickness
member.summary: Specifies the thickness of the arrow shaft. (h * .6); Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.ConnectorAlgorithmParameter.BendPoint
member.summary: Specifies the bend point. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.ConnectorAlgorithmParameter.HasBeginningArrowhead
member.summary: HasBeginningArrowhead. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.ConnectorAlgorithmParameter.HasEndingArrowhead
member.summary: HasEndingArrowhead. Read-only .

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.CycleAlgorithmParameter
member.summary: Represents parameter for cycle algorithm

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.CycleAlgorithmParameter.IsAlongPath
member.summary: If the value is true, the algorithm rotates all child nodes perpendicular to the line from the cycles center to the child node; otherwise, the nodes are not rotated. When alongPath is used, the cycle algorithm does not take rotation into account when determining whether shapes overlap. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.CycleAlgorithmParameter.StartAngle
member.summary: Specifies the angle at which the first shape is placed. Angles are in degrees, measured clockwise from a line pointing straight upward from the center of the cycle. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.CycleAlgorithmParameter.SpanAngle
member.summary: Specifies the angle that the cycle spans. Final layout node text is placed at stAng + spanAng, unless the value of spanAngle is 360. In that case, the algorithm places the layout node so that shapes do not overlap. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.CycleAlgorithmParameter.IsStartElementTransition
member.summary: Specifies the point type of the layout node to use as the first shape in the cycle. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.CycleAlgorithmParameter.IsFirstInCenter
member.summary: A value false specifies to place nodes around a circle. A value true specifies to place the first node in the center and the remaining nodes around the circle. Read-only .

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.HierarchyChildAlgorithmParameter
member.summary: Represents parameter for Hierarchy Child algorithm

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.HierarchyChildAlgorithmParameter.LinearDirection
member.summary: Specifies whether child nodes are arranged from left to right, right to left, top to bottom, or bottom to top. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.HierarchyChildAlgorithmParameter.ChildAlignment
member.summary: Specifies the alignment of child nodes. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.HierarchyChildAlgorithmParameter.SecondaryLinearDirection
member.summary: Specifies whether secondary child nodes are arranged from left to right, right to left, top to bottom, or bottom to top. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.HierarchyChildAlgorithmParameter.SecondaryChildAlignment
member.summary: Specifies the alignment of secondary child nodes. Read-only .

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.HierarchyRootAlgorithmParameter
member.summary: Represents parameter for Hierarchy Root algorithm

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.HierarchyRootAlgorithmParameter.HierarchyAlignment
member.summary: Specifies the layout of hierarchy root and child nodes. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.HierarchyRootAlgorithmParameter.HierarchySecondAlignment
member.summary: Specifies the layout of hierarchy root and child nodes. Read-only .

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.PyramidAlgorithmParameter
member.summary: Represents parameter for pyramid algorithm

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.PyramidAlgorithmParameter.LevelNode
member.summary: If the pyramid has a composite child node, specifies the name of the node that is a child of the composite that makes up the pyramid itself. If the node specifies a trapezoid shape, it modifies the adjustment handles to construct a pyramid. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.PyramidAlgorithmParameter.ChildBackgroundNode
member.summary: If the pyramid has a composite child node, specifies the name of the node that is a child of the composite that makes up the child flyout shape. If the node specifies the nonIsoscelesTrapezoid AutoShape, it modifies the adjust handles to fit the flyout flush against the side of the pyramid. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.PyramidAlgorithmParameter.AccentBackgroundNode
member.summary: If the pyramid has a composite child node, specifies the child node that should hold the child text. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.PyramidAlgorithmParameter.Direction
member.summary: Specifies where the tip of the pyramid starts. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.PyramidAlgorithmParameter.TextDirection
member.summary: Specifies where the text of the first node starts. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.PyramidAlgorithmParameter.AccentPosition
member.summary: Specifies the placement of the second-level child flyouts. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.PyramidAlgorithmParameter.AccentTextMargin
member.summary: Specifies the placement of one edge of the child text. Read-only .

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SnakeAlgorithmParameter
member.summary: Represents parameter for snake algorithm

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SnakeAlgorithmParameter.Breakpoint
member.summary: Specifies the point at which the diagram starts to snake. The value bal specifies that snaking begins at an even number of rows and columns. The value fixed specifies that snaking begins at a fixed point (for example, in a row that contains three nodes). The value endCnv specifies that snaking begins when there is no more room for a shape in the row. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SnakeAlgorithmParameter.BreakpointFixedValue
member.summary: Specifies where the snake should break, if the value of the bkpt parameter is fixed. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SnakeAlgorithmParameter.IsCentred
member.summary: Specifies whether each row and column is centered or offset from the previous row or column. If the value is false, the algorithm uses the alignOff constraint. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SnakeAlgorithmParameter.IsSameDirection
member.summary: Specifies the direction of the subsequent row or column. For example, if the algorithm initially places the nodes from left to right, revDir places the nodes in the next row from right to left. However if the algorithm uses sameDir, the nodes on the next row are arranged from left to right. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SnakeAlgorithmParameter.Direction
member.summary: Specifies from which corner the snake grows. For example, if the algorithm uses the topLeft value, the snake grows from the top left. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SnakeAlgorithmParameter.IsFlowByRows
member.summary: Specifies whether nodes are arranged in rows or columns. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SnakeAlgorithmParameter.HorizontalNodeAlignment
member.summary: Specifies how child nodes are aligned along the x-axis in the extent of the layout node. For example, you can align the tops of all the child nodes by using node alignment, and then center the entire results in the canvas by using horzAlign or vertAlign. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.SnakeAlgorithmParameter.VerticalNodeAlignment
member.summary: Specifies how child nodes are aligned along the y-axis in the extent of the layout node. For example, you can align the sides of all the child nodes but center them vertically in the canvas. Read-only .

member.summary: Represents parameter for Text algorithm

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.TextAlgorithmParameter.AutoTextRotation
member.summary: Specifies how text is oriented relative to the shape. Read-only .

member.summary: Specifies the line spacing after child paragraphs. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.TextAlgorithmParameter.LineSpaceAfterParentParagraphs
member.summary: Specifies the line spacing after parent paragraphs. Read-only .

member.summary: Specifies the line spacing of child text. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.TextAlgorithmParameter.LineSpacingParent
member.summary: Specifies the line spacing of parent text. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.TextAlgorithmParameter.ParentLeftToRightAlignment
member.summary: Specifies the paragraph alignment of parent text when the shape has only parent text; applies when the text direction is left to right. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.TextAlgorithmParameter.ParentRightToLeftAlignment
member.summary: Specifies the paragraph alignment of parent text when the shape has only parent text; applies when the text direction is right to left. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.TextAlgorithmParameter.ShapeTextLeftToRightAlignment
member.summary: Specifies the paragraph alignment of all text in the shape when the shape contains both parent and child text; applies when the text direction is left to right. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.TextAlgorithmParameter.ShapeTextRightToLeftAlignment
member.summary: Specifies the paragraph alignment of all text in the shape when the shape contains both parent and child text; applies when the text direction is right to left. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.TextAlgorithmParameter.StartBulletLevel
member.summary: Specifies whether bullets start at the top level or at the child level. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.TextAlgorithmParameter.VerticalAnchor
member.summary: Specifies the y-axis anchoring of the text area in a shape. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.TextAlgorithmParameter.VerticalAnchorWithChildren
member.summary: Specifies that the definition can allow a different text anchoring on the y-axis, if child nodes exist in the shape. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.TextAlgorithmParameter.IsTextVertical
member.summary: Specifies whether the text block is vertical or horizontal. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.TextAlgorithmParameter.IsTextCentred
member.summary: Specifies the x-axis anchoring of the text area in a shape. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.SmartArt.TextAlgorithmParameter.IsTextCentredWithChildren
member.summary: Specifies that the definition can allow a different text anchoring on the x-axis, if child nodes exist in the shape. Read-only .

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.Export.RenderingFontsInfoMockCanvas
member.summary:
This class is intended to collect the info about fonts which will be used to render current presentation, including all the font substitutions which will occur during rendering.
Intended to be used only with the instances of class. Only method override should be called while mocking of the drawing process.
This class addresses the issue when it's not possible to know the actual fonts used for rendering (and as a result how document really looks when it will be opened by PowerPoint or rendered via Slides). The reqirement to know this without rendering related to SLIDESNET-38422 (we need to know all real fonts to serialize and we not doing any rendering).

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.Export.RenderingFontsInfoMockCanvas.GetFontsInfo(System.Int32[])
member.summary: Information about fonts which will be used during rendering

remarks.p: Has effect only when a document contains JPEG images.

Use this property to get or set the quality of the images inside a document when saving in PDF format. The value may vary from 0 to 100 where 0 means worst quality but maximum compression and 100 means best quality but minimum compression.

member.summary: Specifies compression type to be used for all textual content in the document. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Export.PdfOptions.BestImagesCompressionRatio
member.summary: Indicates if the most effective compression (instead of the default one) for each image must be selected automatically. If set to .true, for every image in presentation the most appropriate compression algorithm will be chosen, what will lead to the smaller size of the resulting PDF document. Best image compression ratio selection is computationally expensive and takes an additional amount of RAM, and this option is .false by default.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Export.PdfOptions.EmbedTrueTypeFontsForASCII
member.summary: Determines if Aspose.Slides will embed common fonts for ASCII (33..127 code range) text. Fonts for character codes greater than 127 are always embedded. Common fonts list includes PDF's base 14 fonts and additional user specified fonts. Read/write .

member.summary: Returns or sets an array of user-defined names of font families which Aspose.Slides should consider common. Read/write [].

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Export.PdfOptions.EmbedFullFonts
member.summary: Determines if all characters of font should be embedded or only used subset. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Export.PdfOptions.JpegQuality
member.summary: Returns or sets a value determining the quality of the JPEG images inside PDF document. Read/write .

remarks.p: Has effect only when a document contains JPEG images.

Use this property to get or set the quality of the images inside a document when saving in PDF format. The value may vary from 0 to 100 where 0 means worst quality but maximum compression and 100 means best quality but minimum compression.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Export.PdfOptions.Compliance
member.summary: Desired conformance level for generated PDF document. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Export.PdfOptions.Password
member.summary: Setting user password to protect the PDF document. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Export.PdfOptions.AccessPermissions
member.summary: Contains a set of flags specifying which access permissions should be granted when the document is opened with user access. See .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Export.PdfOptions.SaveMetafilesAsPng
member.summary: True to convert all metafiles used in a presentation to the PNG images. Read/write .
member.remarks: Default is true. Pdf document can contain vector graphics and raster images. If SaveMetafilesAsPng is set to true then source Metafile image is converted to Png format and saved to Pdf as a raster image. If SaveMetafilesAsPng is set to false then source Metafile is converted to Pdf vector graphics. Each approach has advantages and disadvantages. For example, if Metafile is converted to PNG, then some quality loss is possible during resulting document scaling. If Metafile is converted to Pdf vector graphics, then performance issues in Pdf viewing tool are possible.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.Export.PdfOptions.SufficientResolution
member.summary:
Returns or sets a value determining resolution of images inside PDF document.
Property affects on file size, time of export and image quality.
The default value is 96.
Effect of this parameter depends on few factors. Algorithm tries to get best output image size according to the property value, source image size and image frame size. Using of similar property values may give the same result. Recommended to use step 16 or 32 to get visible effect. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.UnsupportedProps.PPTXUnsupportedProps.Charts.ChartPPTXUnsupportedProps.Use1904DateSystem
member.summary: Relates to "CT_ChartSpace.date1904" elements defined in "dml-chart.xsd" schema file. ----------- Specifies that the chart uses the 1904 date system. If the 1904 date system is used, then all dates and times shall be specified as a decimal number of days since Dec. 31, 1903. If the 1904 date system is not used, then all dates and times shall be specified as a decimal number of days since Dec. 31, 1899. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.UnsupportedProps.PPTXUnsupportedProps.CommentAuthorPPTXUnsupportedProps.ColorIndex
member.summary: Relates to attribute "CT_CommentAuthor@clrIdx" defined in "pml-comments.xsd" schema file. ---------------- Specifies an index into the generating application's comments color table to allow for visual (color) ifferentiation of different author's comments. This color is used for all comments by this author. If more authors exist than there are entries in the color table, the color index wraps around to the beginning of the table. Read/write .
member.remarks: It is left entirely up to the generating application to determine the amount of colors used in the comments color table and in what order these are used when rendering comments on a slide surface.
member.value: -1 means color index is not defined.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.UnsupportedProps.PPTXUnsupportedProps.PictureFramePPTXUnsupportedProps.RelativeResizePreferred
member.summary: Relates to attribute "CT_NonVisualPictureProperties@preferRelativeResize" defined in "dml-documentProperties.xsd" schema file. ----------- Specifies if the user interface should show the resizing of the picture based on the picture's current size or its original size. If this attribute is set to true, then scaling is relative to the original picture size as opposed to the current picture size. Read/write .
member.example: Consider the case where a picture has been resized within a document and isnow 50% of the originally inserted picture size. Now if the user chooses to make a later adjustment to the size of this picture within the generating application, then the value of this property should be checked. If this property is set to true then a value of 50% is shown. Similarly, if this attribute is set to false, then a value of 100% should be shown because the picture has not yet been resized from its current (smaller) size.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.TextFrameFormatEffectiveData.RightToLeftColumns
member.summary: Specifies whether columns are used in a right-to-left or left-to-right order. The usage of this attribute only sets the column order that is used to determine which column overflow text should go to next. This attribute in no way determines the direction of text but merely the direction in which multiple columns are used.

members.member:
Specifies the rotation that is being applied to the text within the bounding box. If it not specified, the rotation of the accompanying shape is used. If it is specified, then this is applied independently from the shape. That is the shape can have a rotation applied in addition to the text itself having a rotation applied to it.
Consider the case where a shape has a rotation of 90 degrees clockwise applied to it. In addition to this, the text body itself has a rotation of -90 degrees counter-clockwise applied to it. Then the resulting shape would appear to be rotated but the text within it would appear as though it had not been rotated at all. >

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.TextFrameFormatEffectiveData.TextHorizontalOverflowType
member.summary: Relates to attribute "CT_TextBodyProperties@horzOverflow" defined in "dml-text.xsd" schema file.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.TextFrameFormatEffectiveData.TextShape
member.summary: Relates to attribute "CT_TextBodyProperties@prstTxWarp" defined in "dml-text.xsd" schema file.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.TextFrameFormatEffectiveData.NormalAutofitFontScale
member.summary: Specifies the percentage of the original font size to which each run in the text body is scaled. In order to auto-fit text within a bounding box it is sometimes necessary to decrease the font size by a certain percentage. Using this prorerty the font within a text box can be scaled based on the value provided. A value of "1" scales the text to 100%, while a value of "0.01" scales the text to 1%. Minimal value is 0.01. Maximum value is 1. This prorerty make sense only when TextFrameEx.AutofitType property value equal to TextAutofitType.Normal.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.TextFrameFormatEffectiveData.NormalAutofitLineSpaceReduction
member.summary: Specifies the percentage amount by which the line spacing of each paragraph in the text body is reduced. The reduction is applied by subtracting it from the original line spacing value. Using this prorerty the vertical spacing between the lines of text can be scaled by a percent amount. A value of "1" reduces the line spacing by 100%, while a value of "0.01" reduces the line spacing by one percent. This prorerty applies only to paragraphs with percentage line spacing. This prorerty make sense only when TextFrameEx.AutofitType property value equal to TextAutofitType.Normal.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.TextFrameFormatEffectiveData.FirstLastParagraphSpacing
member.summary: Specifies whether the before and after paragraph spacing defined by the user is to be respected. While the spacing between paragraphs is helpful, it is additionally useful to be able to set a flag as to whether this spacing is to be followed at the edges of the text body, in other words the first and last paragraphs in the text body. More precisely since this is a text body level property it should only effect the before paragraph spacing of the first paragraph and the after paragraph spacing of the last paragraph for a given text body.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.TextFrameFormatEffectiveData.TextVerticalOverflowType
member.summary: Determines whether the text can flow out of the bounding box vertically. This is used to determine what happens in the event that the text within a shape is too large for the bounding box it is contained within.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.TextFrameFormatEffectiveData.FromWordArt
member.summary: Specifies that text within this textbox is converted text from a WordArt object. This is more of a backwards compatibility attribute that is useful to the application from a tracking perspective. WordArt was the former way to apply text effects and therefore this attribute is useful in document conversion scenarios.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.TextFrameFormatEffectiveData.ForceAntiAliased
member.summary: Forces the text to be rendered anti-aliased regardless of the font size. Certain fonts can appear grainy around their edges unless they are anti-aliased. Therefore this attribute allows for the specifying of which bodies of text should always be anti-aliased and which ones should not.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.TextFrameFormatEffectiveData.RemainUpright
member.summary: Specifies whether text should remain upright, regardless of the transform applied to it and the accompanying shape transform.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.TextFrameFormatEffectiveData.CompatibleLineSpacing
member.summary: Specifies that the line spacing for this text body is decided in a simplistic manner using the font scene.

member.summary: Returns the picture used as a bullet in a paragraph with no inheritance. Read-only .

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.BulletFormatImpl.ApplyDefaultParagraphIndentsShifts
member.summary: Sets default non-zero shifts for effective paragraph Indent and MarginLeft when bullets is enabled (like PowerPoint do if enable paragraph bullets/numbering in it). If bullets is disabled then just reset paragraph Indent and MarginLeft (like PowerPoint do if disable paragraph bullets/numbering in it). Indents shifts are applied in regard to current bullet context - IBulletFormat.Type, .NumberedBulletStyle and FontHeight of first portion. Non-zero indents shifts are applied to effective Indent and MarginLeft of current paragraph (make result values to be local values).

member.summary: Returns or sets vertical anchor text in a TextFrameEx. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.TextFrameFormat.CenterText
member.summary: If NullableBool.True then text should be centered in box horizontally. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.TextFrameFormat.TextVerticalType
member.summary: Determines text orientation. The resulted value of visual text rotation summarized from this property and custom angle in property RotationAngle. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.TextFrameFormat.AutofitType
member.summary: Returns or sets text's autofit mode. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.TextFrameFormat.ColumnCount
member.summary: Returns or sets number of columns in the text area. This value must be a positive number. Otherwise, the value will be set to zero. Value 0 means undefined value. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.TextFrameFormat.ColumnSpacing
member.summary: Returns or sets the space between text columns in the text area (in points). This should only apply when there is more than 1 column present. This value must be a positive number. Otherwise, the value will be set to zero. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.TextFrameFormat.RotationAngle
member.summary: Specifies custom the rotation that is being applied to the text within the bounding box. If it not specified, the rotation of the accompanying shape is used. If it is specified, then this is applied independently from the shape. That is the shape can have a rotation applied in addition to the text itself having a rotation applied to it. The resulted value of visual text rotation summarized from this property and predefined vertical type in property TextVerticalType. Read/write .
member.example: Consider the case where a shape has a rotation of 90 degrees clockwise applied to it. In addition to this, the text body itself has a rotation of -90 degrees counter-clockwise applied to it. Then the resulting shape would appear to be rotated but the text within it would appear as though it had not been rotated at all.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.TextFrameFormat.Transform
member.summary: Gets or sets text wrapping shape. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.TextFrameFormat.KeepTextFlat
member.summary: Gets or sets keeping text flat even if a 3-D Rotation effect was applied. Read/write .

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.TextFrameFormat.GetEffective
member.summary: Gets effective text frame formatting data with the inheritance applied.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.TextFrameFormat.TextShape
member.summary: Relates to attribute "CT_TextBodyProperties@prstTxWarp" defined in "dml-text.xsd" schema file.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.TextFrameFormat.AutofitTypeInternal
member.summary: Gets or sets text autofit mode without "changed" flag updating. This property must be used for deserialization when it is not necessary to call text relayouting.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.TextFrameFormat.RightToLeftColumns
member.summary: Specifies whether columns are used in a right-to-left or left-to-right order. The usage of this attribute only sets the column order that is used to determine which column overflow text should go to next. This attribute in no way determines the direction of text but merely the direction in which multiple columns are used.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.TextFrameFormat.TextHorizontalOverflowType
member.summary: Relates to attribute "CT_TextBodyProperties@horzOverflow" defined in "dml-text.xsd" schema file.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.TextFrameFormat.NormalAutofitFontScale
member.summary: Specifies the percentage of the original font size to which each run in the text body is scaled. In order to auto-fit text within a bounding box it is sometimes necessary to decrease the font size by a certain percentage. Using this prorerty the font within a text box can be scaled based on the value provided. A value of "1" scales the text to 100%, while a value of "0.01" scales the text to 1%. Minimal value is 0.01. Maximum value is 1. This prorerty make sense only when TextFrameEx.AutofitType property value equal to TextAutofitType.Normal.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.TextFrameFormat.NormalAutofitLineSpaceReduction
member.summary: Specifies the percentage amount by which the line spacing of each paragraph in the text body is reduced. The reduction is applied by subtracting it from the original line spacing value. Using this prorerty the vertical spacing between the lines of text can be scaled by a percent amount. A value of "1" reduces the line spacing by 100%, while a value of "0.01" reduces the line spacing by one percent. This prorerty applies only to paragraphs with percentage line spacing. This prorerty make sense only when TextFrameEx.AutofitType property value equal to TextAutofitType.Normal.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.TextFrameFormat.FirstLastParagraphSpacing
member.summary: Specifies whether the before and after paragraph spacing defined by the user is to be respected. While the spacing between paragraphs is helpful, it is additionally useful to be able to set a flag as to whether this spacing is to be followed at the edges of the text body, in other words the first and last paragraphs in the text body. More precisely since this is a text body level property it should only effect the before paragraph spacing of the first paragraph and the after paragraph spacing of the last paragraph for a given text body.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.TextFrameFormat.TextVerticalOverflowType
member.summary: Determines whether the text can flow out of the bounding box vertically. This is used to determine what happens in the event that the text within a shape is too large for the bounding box it is contained within.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.TextFrameFormat.FromWordArt
member.summary: Specifies that text within this textbox is converted text from a WordArt object. This is more of a backwards compatibility attribute that is useful to the application from a tracking perspective. WordArt was the former way to apply text effects and therefore this attribute is useful in document conversion scenarios.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.TextFrameFormat.ForceAntiAliased
member.summary: Forces the text to be rendered anti-aliased regardless of the font size. Certain fonts can appear grainy around their edges unless they are anti-aliased. Therefore this attribute allows for the specifying of which bodies of text should always be anti-aliased and which ones should not.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.TextFrameFormat.RemainUpright
member.summary: Specifies whether text should remain upright, regardless of the transform applied to it and the accompanying shape transform.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.TextFrameFormat.CompatibleLineSpacing
member.summary: Specifies that the line spacing for this text body is decided in a simplistic manner using the font scene.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.TextFrameFormat.MetroBlobRequired
member.summary: Shows if saving the shape containing this object to ppt requires GroupShapeMetroBlob record to save all shape's properties correctly

member.summary: Sets all properties to NotDefined state.
