member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.MasterLayoutSlideCollection
member.summary: Represents a collections of all layout slides of defined master slide. Extends LayoutSlideCollection class with methods for adding/inserting/removing/cloning/reordering layout slides in context of the individual collections of master's layout slides.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.MasterLayoutSlideCollection.AddClone(Aspose.Slides.ILayoutSlide)
member.summary: Adds a copy of a specified layout slide to the end of the collection.
member.remarks: 1) New layout will be linked with parent master slide for this layout slides collection. So this is analogue of copy/paste with "Use Destination Theme" option in PowerPoint. 2) Analogue of this method is method accessed with property.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.MasterLayoutSlideCollection.InsertClone(System.Int32,Aspose.Slides.ILayoutSlide)
member.summary: Inserts a copy of a specified layout slide to specified position of the collection.
member.remarks: New layout will be linked with parent master slide for this layout slides collection. So this is analogue of copy/paste with "Use Destination Theme" option in PowerPoint.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.MasterLayoutSlideCollection.Add(Aspose.Slides.SlideLayoutType,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a new layout slide to the end of the collection.
member.param: Layout type for a new layout. Supported layout types: Title, TitleOnly, Blank, TitleAndObject, VerticalText, VerticalTitleAndText, TwoObjects, SectionHeader, TwoTextAndTwoObjects, TitleObjectAndCaption, PictureAndCaption, Custom. Other layout types are not supported now: Text, TwoColumnText, Table, TextAndChart, ChartAndText, Diagram, Chart, TextAndClipArt, ClipArtAndText, TextAndObject, ObjectAndText, Object, TextAndMedia, MediaAndText, ObjectOverText, TextOverObject, TextAndTwoObjects, TwoObjectsAndText, TwoObjectsOverText, FourObjects, ClipArtAndVerticalText, VerticalTitleAndTextOverChart, ObjectAndTwoObject, TwoObjectsAndObject.

Name for a new layout. If passed name is already in use the ArgumentException will be thrown. If null parameter is passed then name genarated atomatically in regards to passed layout type (for example "Title Slide" or "1_Title Slide", "2_..", etc.).
member.exception: Thrown if unsupported value of parameter is passed. Layout types that are not supported now: Text, TwoColumnText, Table, TextAndChart, ChartAndText, Diagram, Chart, TextAndClipArt, ClipArtAndText, TextAndObject, ObjectAndText, Object, TextAndMedia, MediaAndText, ObjectOverText, TextOverObject, TextAndTwoObjects, TwoObjectsAndText, TwoObjectsOverText, FourObjects, ClipArtAndVerticalText, VerticalTitleAndTextOverChart, ObjectAndTwoObject, TwoObjectsAndObject.
Thrown if layout name value is already in use in this collection of the layouts.
member.remarks: 1) Added layout for value SlideLayoutType.Custom of contains no placeholders and no shapes. 2) Analogue of this method is method accessed with property.

member.exception: Thrown if unsupported value of parameter is passed. member.summary: Represents a collection of all layout slides in presentation. Extends LayoutSlideCollection class with methods for adding/cloning layout slides in context of uniting of the individual collections of master's layout slides.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.GlobalLayoutSlideCollection.AddClone(Aspose.Slides.ILayoutSlide)
member.summary: Adds a copy of a specified layout slide to the presentation.
member.remarks: When cloning a layout between different presentations layout's master can be cloned too to keep source formatting. Internal registry is used to track automatically cloned masters to prevent creation of multiple clones of the same master slide. Manual cloning of master slides will be neither prevented nor registered.

member.summary: Returns or sets Regular font used in case source font is not found. Read/write .

member.summary: Gets or sets the password. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.LoadOptions.OnlyLoadDocumentProperties
member.summary: This property makes sense, if presentation file is password protected. Value of true means that only document properties must be loaded from an encrypted presentation file and password must be ignored. Value of false means that entire encrypted presentation must be loaded with use of right password. If presentation isn't encrypted then property value is always ignored. If document properties of an encrypted file aren't public and property value is true then document properties cannot be loaded and exception will be thrown. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.LoadOptions.WarningCallback
member.summary: Returns or sets an object which receives warnings and decides whether loading process will continue or will be aborted. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.LoadOptions.BlobManagementOptions
member.summary: Represents the options which can be used to manage Binary Large Objects (BLOBs) handling behavior, such as using of temporary files or max BLOBs bytes in memory. These options intended to set up the best performance/memory consumption ratio for a perticular environment or requirements. A Binary Large Object (BLOB) is a binary data stored as a single entity - i.e. BLOB can be an audio, video or presentation itself.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.LoadOptions.DocumentLevelFontSources
member.summary: Specifies sources for external fonts to be used by the presentation. These fonts are available to the presentation throughout its lifetime and are not shared with other presentations

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.LoadOptions.InterruptionToken
member.summary:
The token to monitor for interruption requests.
This token manages the whole instance lifetime. Any long-running operation, such as loading or saving of presentation, will be interrupted via calling of the method of the .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.LoadOptions.ResourceLoadingCallback
member.summary: Returns or sets callback interface which manages external resources loading. Read/write .

member.summary: Gets options for spreadsheets. For example, these options affect calculating formulas for charts.

member.summary: Indicates if password is set

member.summary: Callback object used by HTML import routine to obtain referrenced objects such as images. Using this resolver could create a vulnurability when client provided HTML file will make server software to obtain local or network file. Use with caution. It is recommended not to specify HtmlExternalResolver at all (only embedded objects will be read) or create some subclass which checks if specified uri is valid.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.OdpSerialization.PartParser.StyleOdpDeserialization.DoLoadStyles(Aspose.Slides.OdpSerialization.PartParser.OdpStylesData,System.String,Aspose.Slides.OdpSerialization.OdpStylesDeserializationContext)
member.summary: [odp] 16.2 [style:style]. The determination of the value of a formatting property begins with any style that is specified by an element. If the formatting property is present in that style, its value is used. If that style does not specify a value for that formatting property and it has a parent style, the value of the formatting element is taken from the parent style, if present. If the parent style does not have a value for the formatting property, the search for the formatting property value continues up parent styles until either the formatting property has been found or a style is found with no parent style.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.OdpSerialization.PartParser.StyleOdpDeserialization.StyleLookup(System.String,Aspose.Slides.OdpSerialization.OdpStylesDeserializationContext)
member.summary: [odp] 3.15 Styles. Styles for a document are defined in container elements according to their type: common, automatic and master. 3.15.2 [office:styles]. The [office:styles] element contains common styles used in a document. A common style is a style chosen by a user for a document or portion thereof. 3.15.3 [office:automatic-styles] The [office:automatic-styles] element contains automatic styles used in a document. An automatic style is one contains formatting properties that are considered to be properties of the object to which the style is assigned.

members.member:
Specifies the state that the vertical splitter bar should be shown in. A vertical splitter bar separates the slide from the side content region.
Read/write

Specifies the state that the horizontal splitter bar should be shown in. A horizontal splitter bar separates the slide from the content region below the slide.
Read/write

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.Util.FileLogger
member.summary: Use this class for debugging on the TeamCity server. How to use: 1) Change the "internal" access modificator of the class to "public". 2) Inject to the sources, at the place you want to trace a data, the line: FileLogger.Instance.Write("data\n"); 3) At the beginning of a test call "Open" method and pass a logFileLocation as a parameter (optionally - set MaxLogCalls value) 4) Perform a test. 5) At the end of the test call Close. It, probably, reduces the log file length. 6) When problem will be fixed: rollback all changes, ESPECIALLY which were made on the step number 1 and 2. 7) Check that the tool is not used in the production DLL version.

member.summary: LogIt

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.License
member.summary: Provides methods to license the component.
member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As license = New license License.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic")

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.License.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of this class.
member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As license = New license License.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic")

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.License.SetLicense(System.String)
member.summary: Licenses the component.
member.param: Can be a full or short file name or name of an embedded resource. Use an empty string to switch to evaluation mode.

remarks.p: Tries to find the license in the following locations:
2. The folder of the component assembly.
3. The folder of the client's calling assembly.
4. The folder of the entry assembly.
5. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.
Note:On the .NET Compact Framework, tries to find the license only in these locations:
2. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.

member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As License = New License license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic")

member.summary: Licenses the component.
member.param: A stream that contains the license.

remarks.p: Use this method to load a license from a stream.

member.summary: Reset the license
member.remarks: Use this method to reset license in component

member.returns: True if component is licensed, otherwise false

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.AutoShape.ConfirmTextFrameIsFittedToShape
member.summary: This method used for optimization purposes. When size/position/text of TextFrame is changed or size/position of shape is changed then size/position of shape and TextFrame will be fitted one to other. This "fitting" procedure get many resources and if you know that size/position of shape and TextFrame are already matched one to other than you can cancel upcoming "fitting" procedure with calling this ConfirmTextFrameIsFittedToShape() method. Cancelling will be performed one time, not permanent - this mean that if for example TextFrame will be changed in future then "fitting" procedure will become upcoming again.

member.summary: Returns the ID of a slide. Read-only .

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.BaseSlide.GetHashCode(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns a hash code for the slide.
member.param: 1. Calling with unique = true Returning value is calculated based on slide's structure, SlideId and presentation properties. Resulting hash code can be used for slide identification.In this mode returning value will be unique for every slide within one presentation and for every slide in different presentations unless these presentations are complete clones of each other (one is a pure copy of another without any further modifications). 2. Calling with unique = false Returning value is calculated based on slide's structure only. This mode is useful to find identical slides / layout slides / master slides as the result is equal for slides with the same structure.
member.returns: A SHA1 hash code for the slide.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.BaseSlide.Equals(Aspose.Slides.IBaseSlide)
member.summary: Determines whether the two IBaseSlide instances are equal. Returning value is calculated based on slide's structure and static content. Two slides are equal if all shapes, styles, texts, animation and other settings. etc. are equal. The comparison doesn't take into account unique identifier values, e.g. SlideId and dynamic content, e.g. current date value in Date Placeholder.
member.param: The IBaseSlide to compare with the current IBaseSlide.
member.returns: true if the specified IBaseSlide is equal to the current IBaseSlide; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.Presentation.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: This constructor gets a source file path from which the contents of the Presentation are read.
member.exception: Thrown when input file has zero length

example.code:
[C#]
Presentation pres = new Presentation("demo.pptx");

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.Shape.ConfirmTextFrameIsFittedToShape
member.summary: This method used for optimization purposes. When size/position/text of TextFrame is changed or size/position of shape is changed then size/position of shape and TextFrame will be fitted one to other. This "fitting" procedure get many resources and if you know that size/position of shape and TextFrame are already matched one to other than you can cancel upcoming "fitting" procedure with calling this ConfirmTextFrameIsFittedToShape() method. Cancelling will be performed one time, not permanent - this mean that if for example TextFrame will be changed in future then "fitting" procedure will become upcoming again.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.SlideCollection.AddClone(Aspose.Slides.ISlide)
member.summary: Adds a copy of a specified slide to the end of the collection.
member.remarks: When cloning a slide between different presentations slide's master can be cloned too. Internal registry is used to track automatically cloned masters to prevent creation of multiple clones of the same master slide. Manual cloning of master slides will be neither prevented nor registered. If you need more control over cloning process use or for cloning slides, or for cloning layouts and for cloning masters.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.SlideCollection.AddClone(Aspose.Slides.ISlide,Aspose.Slides.IMasterSlide,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds a copy of a specified source slide to the end of the collection. Appropriate layout will be selected automatically from the specified master (appropriate layout is the layout with the same Type or Name as of layout of the source slide). If there is no appropriate layout then layout of the source slide will be cloned (if allowCloneMissingLayout is true) or PptxEditException will be thrown (if allowCloneMissingLayout is false).
member.param: Master slide for a new slide.

If there is no appropriate layout in specified master then layout of the source slide will be cloned (if allowCloneMissingLayout is true) or PptxEditException will be thrown (if allowCloneMissingLayout is false).
member.exception: Thrown if there is no appropriate layout in specified master and allowCloneMissingLayout is false.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.SlideCollection.InsertClone(System.Int32,Aspose.Slides.ISlide,Aspose.Slides.IMasterSlide,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Inserts a copy of a specified source slide to specified position of the collection. Appropriate layout will be selected automatically from the specified master (appropriate layout is the layout with the same Type or Name as of layout of the source slide). If there is no appropriate layout then layout of the source slide will be cloned (if allowCloneMissingLayout is true) or PptxEditException will be thrown (if allowCloneMissingLayout is false).
member.param: Master slide for a new slide.

If there is no appropriate layout in specified master then layout of the source slide will be cloned (if allowCloneMissingLayout is true) or PptxEditException will be thrown (if allowCloneMissingLayout is false).
member.exception: Thrown if there is no appropriate layout in specified master and allowCloneMissingLayout is false.

member.summary: Returns text's style. Read-only .

member.summary: Returns or sets vertical anchor text in a TextFrame. Read/write .

member.summary: Gets or sets text wrapping shape. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.TextFrameFormatImpl.CenterText
member.summary: If NullableBool.True then text should be centered in box horizontally. Read/write .

member.summary: Determines text orientation. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.TextFrameFormatImpl.AutofitType
member.summary: Returns or sets text autofit mode. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.TextFrameFormatImpl.ColumnCount
member.summary: Returns or sets number of columns in the text area. This value must be a positive number. Otherwise, the value will be set to zero. Value 0 means undefined value. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.TextFrameFormatImpl.ColumnSpacing
member.summary: Returns or sets the space between text columns in the text area (in points). This should only apply when there is more than 1 column present. This value must be a positive number. Otherwise, the value will be set to zero. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.TextFrameFormatImpl.RotationAngle
member.summary: Specifies custom the rotation that is being applied to the text within the bounding box. If it not specified, the rotation of the accompanying shape is used. If it is specified, then this is applied independently from the shape. That is the shape can have a rotation applied in addition to the text itself having a rotation applied to it. The resulted value of visual text rotation summarized from this property and predefined vertical type in property TextVerticalType. Read/write .
member.example: Consider the case where a shape has a rotation of 90 degrees clockwise applied to it. In addition to this, the text body itself has a rotation of -90 degrees counter-clockwise applied to it. Then the resulting shape would appear to be rotated but the text within it would appear as though it had not been rotated at all.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.TextFrameFormatImpl.ThreeDFormatInternal
member.summary: Returns the ThreeDFormat object that represents 3d effect properties for a text. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.TextFrameFormatImpl.AutofitTypeInternal
member.summary: Gets or sets text autofit mode without "changed" flag updating. This property must be used for deserialization when it is not necessary to call text relayouting.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.TextFrameFormatImpl.RightToLeftColumns
member.summary: Specifies whether columns are used in a right-to-left or left-to-right order. The usage of this attribute only sets the column order that is used to determine which column overflow text should go to next. This attribute in no way determines the direction of text but merely the direction in which multiple columns are used.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.TextFrameFormatImpl.TextHorizontalOverflowType
member.summary: Relates to attribute "CT_TextBodyProperties@horzOverflow" defined in "dml-text.xsd" schema file.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.TextFrameFormatImpl.TextShape
member.summary: Relates to attribute "CT_TextBodyProperties@prstTxWarp" defined in "dml-text.xsd" schema file.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.TextFrameFormatImpl.NormalAutofitFontScale
member.summary: Specifies the percentage of the original font size to which each run in the text body is scaled. In order to auto-fit text within a bounding box it is sometimes necessary to decrease the font size by a certain percentage. Using this prorerty the font within a text box can be scaled based on the value provided. A value of "1" scales the text to 100%, while a value of "0.01" scales the text to 1%. Minimal value is 0.01. Maximum value is 1. This prorerty make sense only when TextFrameEx.AutofitType property value equal to TextAutofitType.Normal.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.TextFrameFormatImpl.NormalAutofitLineSpaceReduction
member.summary: Specifies the percentage amount by which the line spacing of each paragraph in the text body is reduced. The reduction is applied by subtracting it from the original line spacing value. Using this prorerty the vertical spacing between the lines of text can be scaled by a percent amount. A value of "1" reduces the line spacing by 100%, while a value of "0.01" reduces the line spacing by one percent. This prorerty applies only to paragraphs with percentage line spacing. This prorerty make sense only when TextFrameEx.AutofitType property value equal to TextAutofitType.Normal.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.TextFrameFormatImpl.FirstLastParagraphSpacing
member.summary: Specifies whether the before and after paragraph spacing defined by the user is to be respected. While the spacing between paragraphs is helpful, it is additionally useful to be able to set a flag as to whether this spacing is to be followed at the edges of the text body, in other words the first and last paragraphs in the text body. More precisely since this is a text body level property it should only effect the before paragraph spacing of the first paragraph and the after paragraph spacing of the last paragraph for a given text body.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.TextFrameFormatImpl.TextVerticalOverflowType
member.summary: Determines whether the text can flow out of the bounding box vertically. This is used to determine what happens in the event that the text within a shape is too large for the bounding box it is contained within.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.TextFrameFormatImpl.FromWordArt
member.summary: Specifies that text within this textbox is converted text from a WordArt object. This is more of a backwards compatibility attribute that is useful to the application from a tracking perspective. WordArt was the former way to apply text effects and therefore this attribute is useful in document conversion scenarios.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.TextFrameFormatImpl.ForceAntiAliased
member.summary: Forces the text to be rendered anti-aliased regardless of the font size. Certain fonts can appear grainy around their edges unless they are anti-aliased. Therefore this attribute allows for the specifying of which bodies of text should always be anti-aliased and which ones should not.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.TextFrameFormatImpl.RemainUpright
member.summary: Specifies whether text should remain upright, regardless of the transform applied to it and the accompanying shape transform.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.TextFrameFormatImpl.CompatibleLineSpacing
member.summary: Specifies that the line spacing for this text body is decided in a simplistic manner using the font scene.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.TextFrameFormatImpl.MetroBlobRequired
member.summary: Shows if saving the shape containing this object to ppt requires GroupShapeMetroBlob record to save all shape's properties correctly

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.BulletFormat.IsBulletHardColor
member.summary: Determines whether the bullet has own color or inherits it from the first portion in the paragraph. NullableBool.True if bullet has own color and NullableBool.False if bullet inherits color from the first portion in the paragraph. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.BulletFormat.IsBulletHardFont
member.summary: Determines whether the bullet has own font or inherits it from the first portion in the paragraph. NullableBool.True if bullet has own font and NullableBool.False if bullet inherits font from the first portion in the paragraph. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.BulletFormat.Picture
member.summary: Returns the picture used as a bullet in a paragraph with no inheritance. Read-only .

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.BulletFormat.ApplyDefaultParagraphIndentsShifts
member.summary: Sets default non-zero shifts for effective paragraph Indent and MarginLeft when bullets is enabled (like PowerPoint do if enable paragraph bullets/numbering in it). If bullets is disabled then just reset paragraph Indent and MarginLeft (like PowerPoint do if disable paragraph bullets/numbering in it). Indents shifts are applied in regard to current bullet context - IBulletFormat.Type, .NumberedBulletStyle and FontHeight of first portion. Non-zero indents shifts are applied to effective Indent and MarginLeft of current paragraph (make result values to be local values).

member.name: T:Aspose.Slides.ProtectionManager
member.summary: Presentation password protection management.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.ProtectionManager.EncryptDocumentProperties
member.summary: This property makes sense, if presentation is password protected. If true then document properties is encrypted in presentation file. If false then document properties is public while presentation is encrypted. Read/write .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.ProtectionManager.IsEncrypted
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this instance is encrypted. Read-only .
member.value: true if presentation was loaded from encrypted file or method was called ; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.ProtectionManager.IsOnlyDocumentPropertiesLoaded
member.summary: This property makes sense, if presentation file is password protected and document properties of this file are public. Value of true means that only document properties are loaded from an encrypted presentation file without use of password. Value of false means that entire encrypted presentation is loaded with use of right password, not only document properties are loaded. If presentation isn't encrypted then property value is always false. If document properties of an encrypted file aren't public then property value is always false. If Presentation.EncryptDocumentProperties is true than IsOnlyDocumentPropertiesLoaded property value is always false. Read-only .

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.ProtectionManager.IsWriteProtected
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this presentation is write protected. Read-only .

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.ProtectionManager.Encrypt(System.String)
member.summary: Encrypts Presentation with specified password.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.ProtectionManager.RemoveEncryption
member.summary: Removes the encryption.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.ProtectionManager.SetWriteProtection(System.String)
member.summary: Set write protection for this presentation with specified password.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.ProtectionManager.RemoveWriteProtection
member.summary: Removes write protection for this presentation.

member.name: M:Aspose.Slides.ProtectionManager.CheckWriteProtection(System.String)
member.summary: Determines whether a presentation is a password protected to modify.
member.returns: True if the password is valid; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: 1. You should check the property before calling this method. 2. When the password is null or empty, this method returns false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Slides.ProtectionManager.EncryptionPassword
member.summary: Gets the password which is used for presentation encryption. Read-only .

member.summary: Gets or sets read-only recommendation. Read/write .

Initializes pies.
Creates a list of pies, starting with the pie that is crossing the 270 degrees boundary, i.e. "backmost" pie that always has to be drawn first to ensure correct surface overlapping.
